headline: Constellation Brands price target lowered to $180 from $200 at TD Cowen
summary: TD Cowen analyst Robert Moskow lowered the firm’s price target on Constellation Brands (STZ) to $180 from $200 and keeps a Hold rating on the shares. The frimlowered its target after learning that the company abruptly dismissed their Beer division’s Chief Customer Officer Bill Renspie. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. headline: Food inflation: How tariffs could impact your grocery bill
summary: Food inflation has begun to slow after the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported prices to have rose 0.2% in February month-over-month. Former United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) economist Richard Volpe sits down with Brad Smith to talk about how tariffs are playing into food and beverage prices, dependent on which countries are being targeted by the Trump administration's trade policies. Volpe is currently a professor of agribusiness at California Polytechnic State University (Cal Poly). Also catch Richard Volpe weigh in on the price pressures multinational agriculture provider Dole plc (DOLE) is facing on pineapples and citrus fruits. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: 3 Stocks Warren Buffett Just Bought
summary: When the stock market falls, investors can always find encouragement to stay the course by seeing relatively low portfolio turnover at Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway.  Berkshire had held large positions in several stocks for years.  Buffett has an unrivaled investing record based on his willingness to pounce when attractive opportunities present themselves and staying focused on the long-term value of the business when Wall Street is panicking.
